title: Agricultural Education: Survey of Ag Systems (2020)
subject: CTE (2020-)

document.title: Arkansas Department of Education Division of Career and Technical Education Survey of Ag Systems Standards

A4AE3FC2E04747779FC922EEC2F582A9.description:
Identify and use hand tools and fasteners (e.g., hammer, screwdriver, needle-nose
pliers, slip-joint pliers, handsaw, common nail, finishing nail, metal screw, wood screw,
bolt, nut, washer, masonry bit, spade bit, circular saw, power drill, hacksaw, ball peen
hammer, twist drill, etc.).

BAA14B8D9C084BC8946E65CF21D90AE4.description:
Identify and use layout tools (e.g., steel tape measure, framing square, speed square,
level, etc.).

25834C4C6FEB497F8449B3F49819DAC8.description:
Explore common skill areas of Agricultural Power, Structural & Technical systems (e.g.,
electricity, fabrication, geospatial technology, hydraulics/pneumatics, concrete/masonry,
painting/finishing, plumbing, small engines, welding, woodworking, etc.).

25F5A0AEF3CA47239D38C1A433552CAF.description: Practice Skills in Power, Structural & Technical Systems.

4B18628C0EF24C79B9E64F8680D33259.description:
Demonstrate the proper personal protective equipment (ppe) in the Power, Structural &
Technical Systems pathway (e.g., eye protection, hair restraint, coveralls, apron, shop
coat, gloves, hard hat, mask, respirator, ear protection, welding helmet, etc.).

6DFCFA74D0964017B6EBD46CC46012B2.description:
Explore fire safety (e.g., Class A,B,C,D and the fire triangle, fire safety equipment, fire
blanket, fire extinguisher, etc.).

9A64791ED72346E5BB1FEDB2E04115BC.description:
Identify safety colors and symbols (e.g., red, orange, yellow, blue, green, black/white,
slow-moving vehicle, etc.).

E907A5F3BB944F0ABBBBE2941FDB1BA3.description: Determine Safety in Power, Structural & Technical Systems.

2DDF5D01B9D54917A5B2D6D5B8B4A5F9.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., agricultural electrician, agricultural equipment dealer, welder,
etc.) and career development events (e.g., agricultural mechanics, agricultural
electricity, etc.) in the Power, Structural & Technical Systems pathway.

0803C6DBBF6F4533AE4106625C039427.description: Examine Careers in Power, Structural & Technical Systems.

DE17F7BAD24C4D309158C9501FA68738.description: Explore Power, Structural and Technical Systems.

05E2216CC71F4F1C81EEF8C15DDCE455.description: Discuss the meaning of compost and explore the composting process.

2CACB0659EBB435BB56BCC22891DBF80.description:
Identify types of pollution and distinguish between point source and non-point source
pollution.

DF4A18DC8BC54BDB97D116A29EBFBFA7.description:
Compare/Contrast conventional (e.g., oil, coal, natural gas, etc.) and alternative (solar,
nuclear, hydro, wind, etc.) energy sources.

92CC69FBF0064E958BB71D57936E3D90.description:
Compare/Contrast the uses of water (e.g., domestic, recreational, irrigation, wildlife
habitat, processing, energy, etc.).

1B22A99989D44768894DD7C13D282C2F.description:
Compare/Contrast the uses of land (e.g., crop, pasture/rangeland, forestland, wetland,
urban, etc.).

3B6011A6D9D446D6AB9B08AF14740E8F.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., environmental conservationist, waste management specialist,
water quality specialist, etc.) and career development events (e.g., land, etc.) in the
Environmental Service Systems pathway.

B7B87B671774425F89DF7612B40A7149.description: Examine Careers in Environmental Service Systems.

5EF6A53B2E6B45CA932F5FB2A80EF8DD.description:
Identify public agencies associated with natural resources (e.g., United States Forest
Service, Arkansas Game & Fish Commission, Natural Resources Conservation Service,
Corps of Engineers, etc.).

1C3CA2A5B7874F309D707D1FE1B63AA4.description:
Discuss recreational uses of natural resources (e.g., hunting, fishing, boating, hiking,
camping, watchable wildlife, etc.).

AF1DA176713A47F8A59A6FB1D24B9649.description: Analyze Uses and Regulations of Natural Resources.

64CACF99A10247F4B1043BE38A953DE0.description:
Explore minerals, ores and fossil fuels commercially extracted in Arkansas (e.g.,
bauxite, bromine, natural gas, crude oil, coal, etc.).

E43AE8C1CE2345EBAB0E2403C6FDB718.description:
Explore major wildlife and aquatic species found in Arkansas (e.g., white tail deer,
turkey, squirrel, duck, black bear, largemouth bass, catfish, trout, striped bass, walleye,
etc.).

2DD5A375AFC24AD6888953FF6BBA5909.description:
Compare/Contrast the two main classifications of trees based on leaf retention
(evergreen, deciduous).

46F0CB1C27BC4CC698F7DCD7C4CBF870.description:
Identify types of renewable and non-renewable natural resources and explore their
uses.

1F65455AE42E4AC7BAC1D9C382E5D372.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., wildlife manager, timber manager, park ranger, etc.) and
career development events (e.g., forestry, agronomy, land, etc.) in the Natural
Resources Systems pathway.

F6C3D115CA5E420A91D9A68141CD56A5.description: Examine Careers in Natural Resources Systems.

D15B0BE9057A46EF8FD5B928DD1CC657.description:
List the agencies that regulate biotechnology and biosecurity (e.g., USDA, EPA, FDA,
Dept of Homeland Security, etc.).

BE3C997E94A14F85B7312AF724E50BD1.description:
Analyze current applications of biotechnology in animal science (e.g., cloning, embryo
transfer, artificial insemination, BST, transgenic organisms, etc.).

7A7F055E3FF549F6BBF10AF75D98C977.description:
Analyze current applications of biotechnology in plant science (e.g., Bt, Round-up
Ready, Tissue culture, Genetic engineering, GMO, etc.).

D42AB92BC7A6452EAC449AA2E9E142A7.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., microbiologist, geneticist, lab technician, etc.) in the
Biotechnology Systems pathway.

125653AA37B94DB6A57C09EDFA7FAB70.description:
Discuss methods of food preservation (e.g., refrigeration, freezing, curing, drying,
canning, etc.).

E139AB5C657F40AB8CD8BF80703F1622.description: List common food-borne pathogens (e.g., salmonella, E-coli, etc.).

69BB13DCD0324D52B9CFBF33AEB27639.description:
Investigate organizations that regulate the food products & processing industry (e.g.,
USDA, FDA, FSIS, etc.).

7CBF4D040F4A4B9189B224DCFA0E33E8.description:
Compare/Contrast components of the food industry (e.g., processing, distribution,
byproducts, etc.).

E861888338384AD98F4A93172BFD50FE.description: Identify sources of foods (e.g., meats, eggs, dairy, fruits, vegetables, grains, etc.).

1DC67201885F4ECD90F7B7FE382CE39E.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., food chemist, food inspector, food scientists, etc.) and career
development events (e.g., food science, poultry evaluation, milk quality and products,
etc.) in the Food Products & Processing Systems pathway

9AEC0CD460024BA1B6BF16CCDE22185F.description: Examine Careers in Food Products & Processing Systems.

6751FB23247F499FB22ADDEBE58A8682.description: Compare soil particles by size (e.g., sand, silt, clay).

FCDCC43075BF41CCA46AC19060E6B36C.description: Identify the three major nutrients found in fertilizer necessary for plant growth (N,P,K)

2639B616B8964A94BF37EFB0F7CDC78E.description: Compare the life cycles of annual biennial and perennial plants.

5FEB22A5D3F14D4998F2041E4896C150.description:
Distinguish between plant processes (e.g., transpiration, photosynthesis, respiration,
etc.).

47684835B1A742EFA994F7EBC3B15A37.description:
Identify the four major parts of a plant and explain their functions (root, stem, leaf,
flower).

572C9A1FF35046FFA556C2AED0F96221.description:
Identify uses of plants (e.g., food, fiber, construction, pharmaceuticals, ornamentals,
etc.).

3E523B1DB3B5404D96C5B9B21CCD037B.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., plant breeder, plant geneticist, plant pathologist, etc.) and
career development events (e.g., agronomy, floriculture, nursery/landscape, etc.) in the
plant systems pathway.

6B45D083FABC433398AF30D5A9898C6F.description: Compare/contrast animal rights and animal welfare.

282A1FB9D3BB4719B25C9CF48843F307.description:
List primary products obtained from animal origins (e.g., beef, pork, lamb, veal, poultry,
mutton, milk, wool, eggs, fish, etc.).

B007B13B412D4771A1B75B2BEF451BAE.description: Classify livestock by digestive systems (e.g., monogastric, ruminant, etc.).

DF4A2D1D7F83456F99092E8A3FFE6D5E.description:
Classify breeds within livestock categories (e.g., Angus, Brahman, Charolais, Hereford,
Holstein, Hampshire sheep, Suffolk, Rambouillet, Boer, Nubian, Duroc, Yorkshire,
Hampshire pig, Landrace, etc.).

547E5980C0DB4E47AFD56EF9E4FA2961.description:
Compare gender and age classification terminology of cattle, chickens, swine, sheep,
goats and horses (e.g., adult male, adult female, young female, castrated male,
newborn, etc.).

F9B66E9EDCB24A6D8E5DB90A70CA60EF.description:
Distinguish between categories of animals (e.g., beef, sheep, dairy, swine, goats,
poultry, aquaculture, equine, wildlife, specialty animal, small animal, etc.).

0BAADC12C6EC41E2BFF02E9842C74227.description:
Investigate careers (e.g., animal nutritionist, animal trainer, veterinarian, etc.) and
career development events (e.g., livestock evaluation, poultry evaluation, horse
evaluation, veterinary science, etc.) in the animal systems pathway

0517F27FCDE84A86A34F54129C0CFFC7.description: Identify types of loans (e.g., short-term, capital, mortgage, etc.).

DAB86EDA019641A19CBFA2C07208E84E.description: Using expenses and income, calculate the profit or loss of an agricultural business.

FF658B15B5234BB4AF5006597938D134.description:
From an inventory, differentiate between common depreciable and non-depreciable
capital items used in agriculture (e.g., feed, seed, fertilizer, stocker cattle, feeder cattle,
breeding livestock, equipment, land, land improvements, etc.).

AB5699A4202642F0A6F399017970AF75.description:
Distinguish between the areas of the Agricultural Industry (e.g., production, processing
& marketing, distribution & sales).

3BE9498028974823845AF6CFD889D37D.description:
Distinguish between the four types of agricultural businesses (sole proprietorship,
partnership, cooperative and corporation).

19F958E1BD354A8BB06054F057B4448B.description:
Investigate Careers (e.g., quality assurance specialist, quality control supervisory,
research economist) and Career Development Events (e.g., Farm and Agribusiness
Management) in the Agribusiness systems pathway.

0B2A9E1C64364E6C96C4F75C06544F51.description: Examine the Organization of Agricultural Businesses.

00AB360717D94FB2A3AD2C6E4C9555E3.description:
Compare/Contrast the types of Supervised Agricultural Experiences and determine the
FFA proficiency awards available (e.g., Entrepreneurship, Placement, Research,
School-based, etc.).

C3F51F5F097547F4989D68C310BF3204.description: Plan and Develop Student Supervised Agricultural Experiences.

AC6FBD0D9D3D4185A9F128F97865B0D1.description:
Discuss the eight pathways of study in Agriculture (e.g., Agribusiness systems, Animal
systems, Biotechnology systems, Environmental service systems, Food products &
processing systems, Natural resources systems, and Power, Structural & Technical
systems).

A4ED3EA7C5EF471DBA9D879621EE78A8.description: Determine the Career Pathways in AFNR.

5FB25515D3DF4BA496F1A7E2E756E543.description: Explore Experiential Learning and Supervised Agricultural Experiences.

BC9DA6D7EF5F4519813AE6C199A26120.description:
List the four main objectives of parliamentary law (focus on one thing at a time, extend
courtesy to everyone, observe the rule of majority and respect the rights of minority)

AF4245D500A54B60BD7C6430841FF154.description:
Analyze the three major divisions of the Program of Activities (growing leaders, building
communities, strengthening agriculture)

A12C977D2DC440DD82E5D69670BFE965.description:
Compare/Contrast the Leadership Development Events (e.g., extemporaneous
speaking, prepared public speaking, creed speaking, parliamentary procedure, conduct
of chapter meeting)

E17BC8ABE0954CD6AF7D5D24536E4133.description: Explain the meaning of the symbol for each officer station

B177E48EBFBE485780A9A680F1500AC8.description:
List the degrees an FFA member may earn (Discovery, Greenhand, Chapter, State and
American)

BC93F9532F114382B09F42A3C9C9583A.description: Explain the significance of the FFA Creed, Motto, Salute and Mission Statement

51F01E30B5204AAE90C6C09D351BBA01.description:
Explain the significance of theses dates in the history of FFA: 1917, 1928, 1965, 1969,
1988

F74242923F9D406BB542536E8FE28319.description:
Identify and explain the meaning of the symbols of the official FFA emblem, the official
FFA colors and the official FFA dress

8C63AF64FCDC4848B5D2F3F453CAAF3D.description:
Explain the three parts to agricultural education (FFA/Leadership, Experiential
Learning/SAE and Classroom/Laboratory).

9A32AEF716704EB3A8AF2F3DA01627E2.description: Explore FFA and Leadership in the Agricultural Industry.

4DD24AF8F8A640F3804004F846B5A3FF.description:
Discuss the changes that have come about in agriculture due to technology (e.g.,
genetic engineering, GPS and computerized equipment)

22764D27661941E69E3066A13C4A8757.description:
List and describe the three major areas of the agricultural industry (supplies & services,
production agriculture and marketing & processing)

693115F96A294212865CF1A3FE930AB3.description:
Determine the impact of agriculture on Arkansas’ economy (e.g., rice, soybeans,
broilers, forest products, jobs, etc.)

2E496E9ED4DB4965BFBCCD6D29A5EEE9.description:
Explain the importance of agriculture in meeting basic human needs (e.g., food, fiber,
shelter, etc.)
